article.headline: Colgate-Palmolive Co. stock rises Thursday, still underperforms market
article.body: Shares of Colgate-Palmolive Co. CL, +1.30% inched 0.78% higher to $78.74 Thursday, on what proved to be an all-around positive trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index SPX, +0.87% rising 0.80% to 3,446.83 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% rising 0.43% to 28,425.51. This was the stock's second consecutive day of gains. Colgate-Palmolive Co. closed $1.35 below its 52-week high ($80.09), which the company reached on September 3rd. The stock demonstrated a mixed performance when compared to some of its competitors Thursday, as Procter & Gamble Co. PG, +0.89% rose 0.68% to $141.65, Unilever PLC ADR UL, +1.44% rose 0.29% to $62.22, and Reckitt Benckiser Group PLC RBGPF, +0.93% rose 1.43% to $96.56. Trading volume (2.1 M) remained 951,413 below its 50-day average volume of 3.1 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
